simulation_equations: k_fold(T, [gnd]) = D_fold * exp(-((DH_U2TS - T*DS_U2TS + DCp_U2TS*(T - T0 - T*ln(T/T0)) - m_U2TS*[gnd]) / (R*T)))
k_unfold(T, [gnd]) = D_unfold * exp(-((DH_N2TS - T*DS_N2TS + DCp_N2TS*(T - T0 - T*ln(T/T0)) - m_N2TS*[gnd]) / (R*T)))
DG_fold(T, [gnd]) = DH - T*DS + DCp*(T - T0 - T*ln(T/T0)) - m*[gnd]
[gnd]_constant_stability(T) = (DG_target - DH + T*DS - DCp*(T - T0 - T*ln(T/T0))) / m
ln(k_fold) vs 1/T for constant DG condition

constants_required.name: DH
constants_required.description: Standard enthalpy change for folding at T0

constants_required.name: DS
constants_required.description: Standard entropy change for folding at T0

constants_required.name: DCp
constants_required.description: Change in heat capacity for folding

constants_required.name: DH_U2TS
constants_required.description: Enthalpy change from unfolded to transition state

constants_required.name: DS_U2TS
constants_required.description: Entropy change from unfolded to transition state

constants_required.name: DCp_U2TS
constants_required.description: Heat capacity change from unfolded to transition state

constants_required.name: m_U2TS
constants_required.description: Denaturant dependence from unfolded to transition state

constants_required.name: DH_N2TS
constants_required.description: Enthalpy change from native to transition state

constants_required.name: DS_N2TS
constants_required.description: Entropy change from native to transition state

constants_required.name: DCp_N2TS
constants_required.description: Heat capacity change from native to transition state

constants_required.name: m_N2TS
constants_required.description: Denaturant dependence from native to transition state

constants_required.name: DG_target
constants_required.description: Target free energy for constant stability condition

variables_to_vary.name: [gnd]_variable
variables_to_vary.description: Variable denaturant concentration adjusted to maintain constant DG for condition 2
variables_to_vary.range: computed from DG_fold equation to maintain DG_target

procedure_steps: Step 1: Initialize all thermodynamic constants (R, T0, DH, DS, DCp, m, DH_U2TS, DS_U2TS, DCp_U2TS, m_U2TS, DH_N2TS, DS_N2TS, DCp_N2TS, m_N2TS, D_fold, D_unfold, DG_target) with values from the constants_required list
Step 2: Create temperature array T ranging from 278.15 K to 338.15 K with 20-30 evenly spaced points

Step 3: CONDITION 1 - Constant denaturant concentration: For each constant denaturant concentration value ([gnd]_constant = 0, 1, 2, 3 M), compute k_fold(T, [gnd]_constant) using the folding rate equation for all temperatures in the array

Step 4: CONDITION 2 - Constant stability: For each temperature T in the array, compute the required denaturant concentration [gnd]_variable(T) that maintains DG_fold(T, [gnd]) = DG_target using the equation [gnd]_constant_stability(T) = (DG_target - DH + T*DS - DCp*(T - T0 - T*ln(T/T0))) / m
Step 5: For condition 2, compute k_fold(T, [gnd]_variable(T)) using the folding rate equation with the temperature-adjusted denaturant concentrations
Step 6: Compute 1/T array (inverse temperature in K^-1) for Arrhenius plot x-axis
Step 7: Compute ln(k_fold) for both conditions (natural logarithm of folding rates)
Step 8: Perform linear regression on ln(k_fold) vs 1/T for condition 2 (constant stability) to extract activation energy: slope = -E_a/R, where E_a is the activation energy
Step 9: Calculate R-squared values for linear fits to quantify linearity of Arrhenius plots for both conditions
Step 10: Generate visualization 1: Plot ln(k_fold) vs 1/T for condition 1 (constant denaturant) showing multiple curves for different [gnd] values - expect non-linear, curved plots
Step 11: Generate visualization 2: Plot ln(k_fold) vs 1/T for condition 2 (constant stability) - expect linear plot with constant slope
Step 12: Generate visualization 3: Plot [gnd]_variable vs T showing how denaturant concentration must be adjusted to maintain constant stability
Step 13: Generate visualization 4: Plot DG_fold vs T for both conditions to verify that condition 2 maintains constant DG while condition 1 shows temperature-dependent DG
Step 14: Compute and report activation energies (E_a) from the slope of linear fits, comparing condition 1 (apparent, variable E_a) vs condition 2 (true, constant E_a)
Step 15: Create summary table showing: temperature range, denaturant concentrations, folding rates, R-squared values for linear fits, and extracted activation energies
expected_outcomes: The simulation should reveal: (1) For constant denaturant concentration (condition 1), Arrhenius plots (ln(k_fold) vs 1/T) will be non-linear and curved, showing apparent temperature-dependent activation energies due to the temperature dependence of protein stability (DG changes with T). Different denaturant concentrations will produce different curved trajectories. (2) For constant stability (condition 2), where denaturant concentration is adjusted to maintain constant DG across temperatures, Arrhenius plots will be linear with a constant slope, yielding a single, well-defined activation energy independent of temperature. The R-squared value for linear regression should be significantly higher (>0.95) for condition 2 compared to condition 1. (3) The denaturant concentration required to maintain constant stability will increase with temperature (positive correlation), demonstrating that higher temperatures destabilize the protein and require compensatory reduction in denaturant. (4) The activation energy extracted from condition 2 represents the intrinsic temperature dependence of the folding process, separated from stability effects. (5) The difference between conditions 1 and 2 quantitatively demonstrates that non-Arrhenius behavior in protein folding is entirely attributable to temperature-dependent changes in protein stability, validating the paper's central claim that stability-corrected kinetics exhibit simple Arrhenius behavior.
